title: More efficient logic is expected for disk sorting when there is a boundary value for the row value
OB: The current logic for disk sorting does not handle cases with a boundary value for the row value correctly.
EB: A more efficient logic should be implemented for disk sorting when there is a boundary value for the row value. The data should be sorted directly in memory and then written to the file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Prepare a dataset with 40000 rows. 2. Set the program to process the data less than 40000 rows. 3. Save the file as a temporary file. 4. Load the file to memory. 5. Perform sorting on the data. 6. Save the sorted data to the temporary file.
